post.title: Christmas Came Early
post.author: abelgaxiola
post.excerpt: My biased opinion regarding my rooted Nook Color? It rocks!
post.content:
I’m now a proud owner of a Nook Color eReader.  I bought my wife a NC for her birthday and wrote about how much I liked it (Nook Color) and even closed by saying that I might buy me one… and well, I did – buy me one.  Except I rooted mine and couldn’t be happier.

I didn’t even know that the NC could be rooted – I didn’t know what rooting meant for that matter – until I came across an article stating that there were Nook Color eReaders selling for $150.00 for the next 8 hours.  The article went ahead and explained how this was a good deal especially since the NC could be rooted by adding a N2A SD card for and additional $35.00.  I’m not very good at math but I know that I paid $250.00 + tax for my wife’s NC, and here the article was talking about converting the NC into an Android device for less than $200.00.

So I did my homework: Google, blogs, YouTube.  Two hours later I placed my order; three days later I received my N2A SD card, and three days after that I received my NC.  Now, my Nook Color is a first class Android device with a dual boot option: I can boot into the original Barnes and Noble OS or the CM7 OS that is installed in the SD card.  Additional Apps that I loaded so far: Pulse, Netflix, Bebbled, Dropbox, Jewels, Movies, Nook Tweaks, Seesmic, and YouTube, to name a few.

My biased opinion regarding my rooted Nook Color?  It rocks!

Ho, ho, ho….
